section.title: Syntax
section.codeblock: cbstats host:11210 [common options] key keyname vbid

section.title: Description
section.p: The following key information is available.

row.entry: The key’s current cas value, as a decimal integer.
Expiration time from the epoch, as a decimal integer.
Flags for this key, as a decimal integer.
If the value is not yet persisted.
If the value is resident in memory.
The vBucket state of this key.

section.p: * key_valid can have the following responses:

dlentry.dd: Some case we didn’t take care of.
The value in memory has not been persisted yet.
The key length in memory doesn’t match the length on the disk.
The data in memory doesn’t match the data on disk.
The flags in memory don’t match the flags on disk.
The key is both on disk and in memory.
The value doesn’t exist yet on disk.

sectiondiv.p: † To find the vBucket ID associated with a given key, you can use the cbc-hash command, which is available as part of the Couchbase C SDK (libcouchbase).

ul.li: For more information on the Couchbase C SDK, see .
For more information on the cbc-hash command, see Couchbase C Client: cbc(1) - Couchbase Client Commandline Utility.

section.title: Example 1: Find the vBucket ID associated with a given key
section.codeblock: 21st_amendment_brewery_cafe: [vBucket=553, Index=1] Server: 10.142.180.102:11210, CouchAPI: http://10.142.180.102:8092/beer-sample Replica #0: Index=0, Host=10.142.180.101:11210

section.title: Example 2: Get key information
section.codeblock: cbstats localhost:11210 -u Administrator -p password -b beer-sample key 21st_amendment_brewery_cafe 553
stats for key 21st_amendment_brewery_cafe key_cas: 1532081261254082560 key_exptime: 0 key_flags: 2 key_is_dirty: false key_is_resident: true key_vb_state: replica
